inputs.task: Design and improve the LaunchBase homepage from first principles
inputs.whitePaper:
LaunchBase is an operating system for small businesses.
Not a website builder. Not another tool. Not a one-time agency project.

LaunchBase is ongoing ownership of a business's digital operating layer:
- website uptime + maintenance
- lead capture + forms
- monitoring + safety decisions
- updates + publishing cadence
- integrations + visibility
- logging + accountability

LaunchBase exists because most small businesses already have tools, but no one owns the system.
They have a website, a payment tool, a calendar, a Google profile, and logins…
…but the owner still carries the burden of making sure everything works.

LaunchBase sells relief from that cognitive load.

Core customer pain: The customer isn't buying a website. They're buying the ability to stop thinking about:
- "Is it still working?"
- "Did that form actually send?"
- "What should I post?"
- "Is anything broken?"
- "Am I missing something?"

This is background anxiety, not a feature gap.
The enemy is not "lack of tools."
The enemy is lack of ownership.

LaunchBase replaces the customer as the default system-checker.

Promise:
✅ Change is reversible
✅ Non-action is safe
✅ Silence is a valid decision
✅ Every action is logged
✅ Customer sees their real site before paying
✅ LaunchBase acts only after approval

The brand is accountability.
LaunchBase is responsibility-as-a-service.

Target customer:
- owner-operator
- service business
- small team
- not "tech obsessed"
- wants a business to run, not to "manage tools"

Tone: calm, competent, honest, operationally serious, safety-first, premium but not flashy.
This is a systems product, not a "creative brand party."

Design objective:
✅ Create instant trust
✅ Communicate the contract clearly
✅ Show the "safe-by-default" nature
✅ Make "Hand It Off" feel low-risk
✅ Explain observability in plain English
✅ Look premium enough to justify recurring ownership

currentCopy.hero: Stop carrying the system in your head. Hand it off. Keep visibility.
currentCopy.problem: No one owns the system. You're the fallback for everything.
currentCopy.solution: LaunchBase becomes the owner. You stay informed, not involved.
currentCopy.trust: Safe by default. Fully logged. Reversible.

inputs.audience: Owner-operators of service businesses (fitness studios, coffee shops, consulting firms) who want stability and accountability, not tool management
inputs.tone: Calm, minimal, trustworthy, premium. Avoid hype. Avoid 'AI magic.' Avoid exaggerated claims.
inputs.constraints: Mobile-first. Must feel like 'responsibility-as-a-service.' Must emphasize safety, reversibility, observability. Must reduce mental load while reading.

proposedChanges.value: Add a small video or animation loop in the hero section illustrating the hand-off process visually.
proposedChanges.rationale: Engages visitors quickly and visually explains the core promise.
risks: Slight increase in load time

proposedChanges.value: Introduce a sticky navigation bar with quick links to 'How It Works', 'Pricing', and 'Trust' sections.
proposedChanges.rationale: Improves site navigation and quick access to key sections.
risks: May distract users from main content

proposedChanges.value: Merge 'Problem' and 'Solution' into a two-column layout for desktop with visual icons representing each point.
proposedChanges.rationale: Enhances clarity and scannability by visually contrasting the problem and solution.
risks: May compress content on smaller screens

proposedChanges.value: Increase section gap to 80px on desktop for better content separation.
proposedChanges.rationale: Improves readability and reduces cognitive load by clearly delineating sections.
risks: May increase overall page length

proposedChanges.value: Convert pricing tables to cards with one highlighted default tier; add 'what you get' bullets.
proposedChanges.rationale: Makes pricing easier to understand and highlights the most recommended plan.
risks: May oversimplify complex pricing

proposedChanges.value: Add sticky primary CTA on mobile after 40% scroll; keep secondary CTA in hero only.
proposedChanges.rationale: Ensures CTA visibility without overwhelming the visitor.
risks: May be intrusive on smaller screens

proposedChanges.value: Add a small activity-feed preview component in the 'Trust' section showing example logs.
proposedChanges.rationale: Demonstrates the auditability feature and builds trust.
risks: May clutter the section if not designed well

proposedChanges.value: Introduce a proof bar with logos of well-known clients or testimonials above the fold.
proposedChanges.rationale: Builds immediate trust through social proof.
risks: May detract from the primary message if overemphasized

proposedChanges.value: Ensure h1 text size is prominent (e.g., 48px) to capture attention immediately.
proposedChanges.rationale: Improves the hierarchy and ensures the main message is immediately visible.
risks: Could overwhelm smaller screens if not responsive

proposedChanges.value: Implement a vertical stacking of hero elements on mobile with reduced padding.
proposedChanges.rationale: Improves readability and accessibility on smaller screens.
risks: May reduce the impact of visual elements

proposedChanges.value: Use 18px base font size with 1.6 line-height for body text to ensure readability
proposedChanges.rationale: Improves readability and creates a calm and confident tone
risks: May require more vertical space, affecting layout

proposedChanges.value: Set max text width to 65ch for body copy to improve readability
proposedChanges.rationale: Prevents text from being too wide, reducing cognitive load during reading
risks: Content might seem longer, requiring more scrolling

proposedChanges.value: Use pill-shaped buttons with 16px padding, subtle shadow, no gradients
proposedChanges.rationale: Creates a premium feel and emphasizes safety and trust
risks: May not stand out enough without gradients

proposedChanges.value: Adopt a card style with 8px radius, light shadow, and 24px padding
proposedChanges.rationale: Enhances the premium feel while maintaining operational seriousness
risks: May seem too minimal if users expect more visual flair

proposedChanges.value: Integrate a 3-chip row below the hero: 'Safe by default • Fully auditable • Reversible changes'
proposedChanges.rationale: Quickly communicates key trust signals, reinforcing brand promises
risks: Chips may not be noticed if placed too low below the hero

proposedChanges.value: Use a subtle timeline layout with icons for audit log preview to enhance clarity
proposedChanges.rationale: Visually separates logged activities, reinforcing safety and accountability
risks: May require more space, impacting layout

proposedChanges.value: Adopt a calm blue (#4A90E2) as primary color to convey trust and safety
proposedChanges.rationale: Aligns with brand's calm and trustworthy personality
risks: Color may not stand out enough for emphasis

proposedChanges.value: Use a muted gold (#D4AF37) for accents to maintain premium feel
proposedChanges.rationale: Provides a subtle but noticeable highlight for important elements
risks: Accent color might not contrast well with certain backgrounds

proposedChanges.value: Incorporate a light grid pattern background for sections to add subtle depth
proposedChanges.rationale: Adds visual interest without overwhelming the calm design
risks: May interfere with text readability if not executed carefully

proposedChanges.value: Use thin, light gray dividers (1px) to separate sections and enhance hierarchy
proposedChanges.rationale: Subtly organizes content, supporting a calm and operationally serious tone
risks: Dividers might be too subtle and not noticeable enough

swarm.reason: Missing craft or critic artifact for collapse
